posts.post_title: Emergency sale- T206 Cobb- T200 CObb and others
posts.post_content:
Posted By: Dan Koteles
I wanted to wait until after CHristmas to post this sale, but I have to get some things in order because I will be traveling out of state to get my wife the best health care possible. We just recieved some news on a serious health issue. While I do have Blue Cross- I have to get my store bills ahead for a month and have money for some travel expenses. If we leave for awhile I will be taking my animals and renting elsewhere until I get some better health news. I appreciate any help.


CObb T206 -1950.00-BVG 4.5.....this card should regrade anywhere a 5.5 and I will guarantee a 5 from the others. I paid 2100.00 because I like it so well. SOLD SOLD SOLD SOLD

T200 Detroit- 3500.00- This one I will miss . I think it is undergraded and should be a 7. You will not see another one like this . No marks of any kind , in fact the card looks brand new.
PENDING SALE


This is a card for Detroit Joe -Jim.B- or Jeff Lichtman, the high grade guys ,I know there are a few others. PSA5....uh uh no way. I will guarantee a 6 or I will buy back within 60 days. THIS CAME FROM A RAW FIND OF THE ORIGINAL COLLECTOR !!!

T205 Johnson - PSA4.....looks better then the 3 available on ebay at 999- 1250-1650.00.........925.00...SOLD SOLD. 

[IMG]http://www.network54.com/Realm/tmp/1230316442.JPG[/IMG] [IMG]http://www.network54.com/Realm/tmp/1230316504.JPG[/IMG] [IMG]http://www.network54.com/Realm/tmp/1230316547.JPG[/IMG] 


THANK YOU ALL VERY MUCH !

posts.post_title: Emergency sale- T206 Cobb- T200 CObb and others
posts.post_content:
Posted By: Ken McMillan
Dan,  

My wife and I relocated from Arizona to St. Louis 1 1/2 years ago for similar reasons.  She went to Barnes Hospital in St. Loius for lung volume reduction surgery and did well enough that we are now back in Arizona.  We were originally looking at lung transplant before we went to Barnes as our insurance was no longer accepted at UCSD in San Diego.  The lord works in strange ways as we were originally told in San Diego that she needed a transplant.  After  LVRS at Barnes, she is oxygen free and no rejection drugs.  Keep your chin up and things will work out as it did for us.

Kmac

Posted By: Jason L
via any purchases (and it looks like those are going farily well!!!)
I just wanted to extend my best wishes to you and your wife as you go thru this.  Your health is so easy to take for granted, and can be devastating to repair.  

She is lucky to have someone with such dedication to her support, and I wish you both nothing but the best in 2009 and beyond as you battle the problem.  

Be vigilent, there are NO stupid questions, you are the customer and the doctors and facilties are people and processes that must be pushed and driven to your satisfaction. 

hang in there.
